intro: Rosa micrantha subvar. polyacantha, commonly known as the many-thorned shrub rose, is a compact, deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It features small, fragrant flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in clusters during late spring to early summer. The plant has dense, thorny stems and dark green, leathery leaves that provide a rugged appearance. Its growth habit is bushy, making it suitable for use as a hedge or ornamental plant. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, and is relatively low maintenance once established.
